title: How to Draw a Cello

steps.headline: Draw a rounded rectangular shape with a long rectangle for the finger board.
Add a curve line on the sides of the rounded rectangle.
steps.description: Erase the previous lines and draw a shape like an ice cream cone at the bottom. This will serve as a tailpiece. Add small circles on the edge of the long rectangle above.

steps.headline: Make an outline for the sketches.
Add the scroll on top of the fingerboard, a bridge in the middle of the cello's body and an S shape on each side
Make small circles at the side of the scroll at the top for tuning pegs.
steps.description: This is where you tune your cello.

steps.headline: Color the body a woody shade.
steps.description: This could be brown or maroon and grey on the fingerboard and tailpiece

steps.headline: Add 4 lines from scroll to the tailpiece.
steps.description: These will be the strings. White lines are best, but black or grey work too.

text: Draw a rounded rectangular shape with a long rectangle for the finger board.  Add a curve line on the sides of the rounded rectangle. Erase the previous lines and draw a shape like an ice cream cone at the bottom. This will serve as a tailpiece. Add small circles on the edge of the long rectangle above. Make an outline for the sketches.  Add the scroll on top of the fingerboard, a bridge in the middle of the cello's body and an S shape on each side  Make small circles at the side of the scroll at the top for tuning pegs. This is where you tune your cello. Color the body a woody shade. This could be brown or maroon and grey on the fingerboard and tailpiece Add 4 lines from scroll to the tailpiece. These will be the strings. White lines are best, but black or grey work too.
